Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @jl777c I understand right now, the daemon can be built with only one of the dynamic modules: rogue or musig, but if in the future daemon is built with both modules present, can `-ac_cclib` take both the modules rogue,musig as parameters and start a chain?

Author: jl777c#5810
jl777c#5810
Content: evalcode 19 is EVAL_DILITHIUM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang the idea is that there is a libcc dynamic lib that has all the CC you want in it. there needs to be a sane build process to make this. unfortunately i dont really do build process, i just write code so someone else will need to make it a sane process. the important thing is that N different CC can be bundled into a single libcc

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Got it, can `-ac_cclib` take multiple modules as parameters and the chain have all the specifies modules enabled?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea is that there is a libcc dynamic lib that has all the CC you want in it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: did you understand that part?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so make a single libcc with all the CC you want in it. why would you need to specify multiple modules?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: oh , these modules in the libcc will be available along with faucet,dice, rewards just through `-ac_cc`?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the build in CC and the ones in the libcc are available

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Got it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can even limit which of the built in ones are available with -ac_ccenable=evalcode0,evalcode1,...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in which case only the specified evalcodes are available

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plus whatever ones are in libcc if ac_cclib was there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is not much "smarts" to what is available or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is there and not disabled, it is there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it isnt there or is disabled, it cant be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: chain creation needs to make sure the specific CC available are the ones they want

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
>What are: PubkeyCCaddress(CClib), CClibCCTokensAddress

Not sure of this question.

>What is the difference between myCCAddress(CClib) and myCCAddress

CCAddress is the address calculated from the EVAL code from the specific CC

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: CC address of yours would be different to normal KMD/Assetchain Address, but it'd be specific to your own `pubkey`'s

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: You need to start your CC enabled chain with a `pubkey` on daemon start.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Or at least setpubkey for that CC chain if it's already started

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: So, you get the CCAddress for that same pubkey,

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I guess that's the description, unless it needs correction.
